title: PHPatan()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPatan()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example Return the arc tangent of different numbers with the atan() function: "); echo(atan(-0.50) . "
"); echo(atan(5) . "
"); echo(atan(-5) . "
"); echo(atan(100) . "
"); echo(atan(-100)); ?> Definition and Usage The atan() function returns the arc tangent of arg as a numeric value between -Pi/2 and Pi/2 radians. Syntax atan( arg ); Parameter Values Parameter Description arg Required. Specifies an argument to process Technical Details Return Value: The arc tangent of arg in radians Return Type: Float PHP Version: 4+ ★ +1

summary: This tutorial covers PHPatan()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPatan()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPatan()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
